website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-read tuner that is suitable for orchestral instruments, including guitar.
pros: Easily calibrated, and the tuner comes with a reference pitch
Designed to stay on a music stand so you can perform hands-free tuning
cons: Some people have had difficulty using this tuner on extremely high or low piano notes

customer_reviews.title: Will not tune lower six or higher six strings. Just sows blank screen at low and high keys
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tuner that would pick up the extreme low and extreme high notes on piano keys. I was assured it would do the job. It will not pick up the sound or vibration when trying to tune lower or higher keys (notes)! All keys in middle section of piano are picked up and show clearly on review screen. If anyone knows of a piano tuning device that will pick up extreme high and extreme low keys, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Shipped by Amazon fom BUYERS

customer_reviews.title: Solid tuner, but be warned: it's hard to read
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tuner for use as a music teacher. The output jack is super useful for teaching electric guitar, but it's hard to read the screen and many students, for example, overtighten their string because F looks so similar to E without a backlit screen. But really: fair price and good product. Just consider something else if you are concerned about reading the screen
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as CA40
customer_reviews.text: Comparing with CA40, it’s harder to open battery compartment, the screen is harder to read, and the measure is a little higher.
customer_reviews.author: NY resident

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic tough accurate tuner, has an input and output to install in line, if needed. The mic picks up quickly too. I've had Korgs for many years . Sold cases of them, seen one to not work, but only after it fell down the stairs, outside. The metal ones. In the rain. Another that did (!) ( I know stupid is as stupid does), dried out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and is accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I think this device works well. It is a little sensitive, but it is accurate and extremely easy to use. I wish the display was lighted, because in average light it is a little difficult to read. In bright light however, it is very easy to see and read. All in all, it has some good features. I has LED indicator lights to tell you when you are in tune, or sharp or flat, so you really don't even need to look at the display to use this nice feature. Mine came calibrated to 440 HZ for A, which is correct. The batteries were easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unable to tune high and low notes on a piano.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I find this updated version easy to use and keeps me in tune
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed! I can use this with my Electric ukulele as well as my clarinet. It's an updated version of one I used to have (I had an older model of this same brand). I find this updated version easy to use and keeps me in tune.
customer_reviews.author: A.A.Z

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product to my Hungarian Zither!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect product to tuning my (Hungarian) Zither! I've purchased that zither - more precisely, ordered - some weeks ago and I got it in the last two days. (Well, international shipping is extremely slow...). Of course, in the long transit, the wires of my beloved (new!) zither got out of tune. This is actually a very frequent problem with new zithers, because the wood becomes dry... Thus, I had to re-tuning it! And this "Other Tuner" product helped me SOOO much! My job became pretty easy. Yes, this is a perfect product for zithers, actually - I think - for each wired musical instrumments, although I made a try only on zither.
customer_reviews.author: madscientist

customer_reviews.title: Very dim display
customer_reviews.text: It works about the same as any other electronic tuner these days, tracks pitch well etc. but be advised, the LCD display is VERY dim and can only be seen from a certain angle. There is no backlight option. If you only plan to use it in well-lit areas I suppose it'll work fine but forget about using it on stage or around a campfire. Tuners are cheap nowdays. You can do better for the money. Go with an LED display like a Snark or an LCD with a light.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mcgraw

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and basic
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and it is inexpensive. It uses a needle to indicate how far your tone is from the desired frequency. This really doesn't inform you precisely how far away you are in terms of frequency, but it lets you know whether you are in tune.
customer_reviews.author: Peter L. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. Not that good.
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate, not precise. Too much wobble room. Not worth the money for tuning piano.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tuner & price. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Tuned my piano. Frequency of highest 6-8 notes out of range for tuner, but my old Yamaha tuner was the same. Not sure any tuner has the range for all 88 piano keys. It did what I needed at an exceptional price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine B. Barrie

customer_reviews.title: doesn't appear to tune accurately
customer_reviews.text: I am ALWAYS extremely flat on this tuner, but any other tuner or iphone tuner device I check on (and when playing in orchestra) I am very close to perfect pitch. It does not appear to work no matter what I try!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Kassner

customer_reviews.title: Frequency limited
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this to tune my piano. I bought this and the mic and the lower & higher end frequencies do not even register. This is no different than the tuner app I have on my phone. Considering returning them both.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this tuner!! It is small and lightweight, yet easy to read. It is accurate. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CheChe

customer_reviews.title: Make piano tuning easy
customer_reviews.text: Makes piano tuning easy. Does about 5 octaves. Wish it did more
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So easy to use! Fits in my case and doesn’t take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Wells

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tuner for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect the world's best tuner, but if you need a small device that can handle a contact mic, this is your device!
customer_reviews.author: Jam7x1

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are a very musical Family and we’ve used this to tune a harpsichord, piano, cello, viola, violin, guitar, and it works perfectly!! Easy read, and easy use!
customer_reviews.author: TuesdeeB

customer_reviews.title: Korg Tuner is easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size of this tuner. It is not a complicated piece of equipment. Very easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Love My New Tuner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a backup tuner, but now I use it all the time. Reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hughes, CPA, Ph.D., and Small Business Consultant

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: As I am finally learning to play a harp, after waiting for decades, this Korg is marvelous; since I do not have to tune a piano every time I play, I needed a highly accurate tuning aid.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: If it were backlit, it would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional musician. I love this tuner so much I bought two. I wish the display were backlit but otherwise this little gadget does its job well. Very happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: T. Grammer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: My old Korg tuner died after a long time of usage. I replaced it with this one to be pretty dissatisfied. This is not built the best, and the batteries that came with it gave out only using 5 times. I am an oboist so a reliable tuner is important.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tuner!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my eight year old granddaughter to use with her violin. She loves it and can use it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: REG

product_meta.title: Other Tuner (CA50)
product_meta.description: A portable, pocket-sized tuning solution. The CA-50: the standard tuner for orchestral instruments, now with even better visibility. The CA-50 features high-precision tuning functionality and a slim and compact design. The new CA-50’s display is now, even easier to read. Long considered the standard in chromatic tuners, the CA-50 offers simple and intuitive operation and a satisfying tuning experience for every instrumentalist.
feature_bullets: An even more readable display, with a larger note name indication
A wide detection range supports tuning for any instrument
Marks provided to indicate pure major And minor third intervals

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars436 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
